description.en: The policies of persistent data management for meeting legal and business data archival requirements
The date on which the data retention stops
The duration of the data retention, starting from the start date
Indicates that the information w.r.t. the Data Retention is shown in a human readable form.
The legal basis that substantiates the data retention
Stating if the data should be a snapshot (i.e., not live data) or if the consent requires access to the latest version of the data (i.e., live data)
The moment in time when the data retention starts
Processing specifies what is happening to/with the data.
Specifying when or under which quantifiable condition(s) the consent will expire
The time between moments in time when the data may be retreived for processing
The moment in time up to which the data may be processed
The number of times the data may be processed
The duration during which the data may be processed
A filter added to the personal data to further limit the specifications of the personal data.
A period of time.
Condition for evaluation or assessment.

usage.en: Checking the Criterion can require extra info (hence the class InformationRequirement) which in turn can require the class Evidence. A full description of this class is to be found in the CCCEV-ontology.

description.en: Information about the characteristics of an Evidence.

usage.en: A full description of this class is to be found in the CCCEV-ontology.

description.en: Requested data that is to be proven by Evidence.

usage.en: A full description of this class is to be found in the CCCEV-ontology.

description.en: An organization that is legally registered
The legal name of the organisation.
The registration is a fundamental relationship between a legal entity and the authority with which it is registered and that confers legal status upon it.
Document containing detailed information on the identity of the controller, the planned processing operations, the purpose and legal basis and on the measures taken to protect its data.
Person whose information is recorded in a register.
Identification code of the person in the register.
The full name of the person, in a general a combination of the first and last name.
A processor means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller.

usage.en: A data processor will only be used if the controller is commissioned by the data controller to perform the processing for the data controller.

description.en: Unique method to prove the identify of the Data Processor.
The legal name under which the Data Processor is registered.
The Legal basis used to justify processing of personal data

A high-level Class to describe 'data handling'. This can consist of personal data being processed for a purpose, involving entities, using technical and organisational, applicable risks, rights, and legal basis.
Stating if the data should be a snapshot (i.e., not live data) or if the consent requires access to the latest version of the data (i.e., live data)
A type of personal data
A category of personal data
The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected.
A risk or possibility or uncertainty of negative effects, impacts, or consequences.
Technical measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected.
A risk or possibility or uncertainty of negative effects, impacts, or consequences.
Someone or something that can perform actions or produce an effect.
Consent of the data subject regarding processing of their personal data
The moment in time in which this specific version of the consent was created

usage.en: This moment changes whenever the status of the consent is being updated. For example, when a data controller requests a consent a consent will be made with the creation time being equal with the moment of the request. When later on the data subject gives consent a new consent will be made with a new status (e.g. explicitlyGiven) and the creation time of this consent will be equal to the moment in which the data subject has granted consent.

description.en: The personal data for which the consent was given
A newer version of a consent invalidates a previous version of the consent
A previous version of the consent is invalidated by a newer version of the consent
The consent that is provided to the data controller
The location where this specific version of the consent was created
The way this specific version of the consent was created
Additional note added to the consent
Represents the status of consent for the data subject.

usage.en: This allows persisting the determination of the validatity or suitability of consent (as an entity or instance) for use in processing and other activities. Examples: consent is given, consent is requested but not given, consent was withdrawn.

description.en: Links a consent instance with the data subject it is associated with.
Denotes that this consent instance is the previous consent for the specified consent instance.
Specifies the delegation that provided this consent.
Indicates the Person or Data Controller the consent was provided to.

A Data Controller is defined as "The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data."
Refering to the possibility for a data controller to withdraw the consent

usage.en: This should be used in cases where the data controller made a mistake in the consent. To stop the request or make a new one the controller should first withdraw the previous consent.

description.en: The consent was provided to the data controller
The individual whose personal data is being processed.
Refering to the possibility for a data subject to cancel a previously given consent
The data subject is the entity which provided the consent
Links a data subject to their consent.
A Delegation of consent occurs when another entity, whether a data subject or their representative or an automated mechanism, provides the consent on behalf of the intended Data Subject.
TO DO
The delegation is a consent delegation for someone to give consent in name of the data subject
Represents a consent entity that is considered given whether implicitly, explicitly, or by delegation.
A Minor is a Data Subject who cannot provide their own consent (that is legally valid). Therefore, their consent must be obtained via a Guardian or Legal Representative or Parent.
Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (i.e., the DataSubject).
Links personal data with the consent it is associated with.
Processing specifies what is happening to/with the data.
Indicates wheter a ThirdParty in involved in processing the data or not.

usage.en: For example the dataProcessor that processes the data on behalf of the DataController.

description.en: Purpose refers to the aim or goal towards which the data is processed (or associated with any other form of action).
Represents an Agent that is a Person or an Organisation other than the current entity (w.r.t. data protection laws).
A temporal entity with non-zero extent or duration.
Time instant at which the Period was terminated.
Time instant at which the Period was initiated.
Information used to uniquely identify of an object.

usage.en: The basic principle here is that this string is assigned by an organisation and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

description.en: Link to the Agent that issued the identifier.
The date on which the identifier was issued.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: The type of the string refers to the identification system (including its version), the string itself refers to the actual identifier.

description.en: Name of the Agent that issued the identifier.

A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth.
